alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 7:27PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Rio Arriba, Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Embudo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor overbank flows are occurring above the Embudo gauge site. Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar and below the Taos Junction Bridge along state route 570 will be limited if further rises occur. Other localized effects due to the high water levels will begin to be felt at a stage of 10 feet but no significant flooding is expected until the river rises to 12 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 8.2 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning around 1000 AM MDT.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe
